Key Match Events: The Blazers generated energy off of their defense, and a slow unraveling started to occur from there.
Portland scored 21 points off of those 14 Wolves turnovers. Minnesota scored just 12 points off of Portland's 20.
The Wolves finished the game 7-39 from three point range. That's 17 percent for those keeping track at home.
Post-Match Reflections: Head Coach Chris Finch said, 'We couldn’t make a shot all night, and they threw in some timely ones. We had a bunch of good looks that we didn’t make.'
Finch said, 'It’s a rough patch, It’s early on.'
Finch said, 'I thought he came in and gave us really good minutes. It was a good first showing for sure.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Wolves have dropped three straight to sub.500 teams in the worst ways.
This was the Wolves' third straight loss, and they've scored less than 100 points in two of them.
The game takes place on Friday, November 15 at 9:00pm CT.
Others: Donte DiVincenzo had a tough game, shooting 1-10 from the field (0-6 from three) and clocked a minus eight.
Rob Dillingham had a positive first showing, with a pass-first mindset and scrappy defense.
Rudy Gobert had a bad back-to-back, with lackluster rim protection and subpar running the floor.
